stream_context.summary: Kaze live-builds the new mine section of Course 12, turns the level into a Goomba bandit hideout with fireplaces, red-coin placements and future minecart mechanics, and describes a Wild-West Boshi showdown and broader course restructuring.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 has been restructured: one sub-area was cut and the train station entrance was moved to the main hub.
development_findings.quote: We removed one area and instead the train station is right here now.

development_findings.summary: A Boshi Wild-West ‘shoot-out’ cut-scene will replace the Goombas-in-trenchcoats encounter; the player must press B before Boshi to win a star.
development_findings.quote: There's gonna be a countdown and you have to press B before he does to kill him; then he gives you a star and he's like, I'm so sorry, I'll stop being a bandit.

development_findings.summary: The mine section is being designed as the Goomba gang hideout: Goombas wield cork-guns, campfires act as light sources, wobbling platforms and spiral towers enable free-flow movement, and red-coin placement is being finalised.
development_findings.quote: This will be the Goomba gang's hideout… they’ll be standing around here, shooting cork guns at you.

development_findings.summary: Future minecarts will act as moving platforms: Mario can ride them downhill and use the conserved momentum to reach distant ledges.
development_findings.quote: There will be minecarts here… you can step on and then they will drive you down, and then you can use the inertia from them to go even further.

development_findings.summary: Level-design workflow: Kaze blocks out full geometry first, then Biobak polishes visuals; his ability to model directly speeds iteration.
development_findings.quote: We first make the level design and then we make the visuals… because I'm able to 3D model I can just make any shape I want.

development_findings.summary: Performance idea noted: convert per-frame linked-lists (collision & actor lists) into arrays during level load to improve throughput.
development_findings.quote: Maybe there should just be arrays formed when the level boots… a good idea, I'm gonna note that.

development_findings.summary: Persistent compiler warning about the fp register being bound to multiple values remains unsolved; he experimented with pragma system_header to silence it.
development_findings.quote: That warning cannot be ignored… on every thread this register has a different value.

development_findings.summary: Using an unreleased ‘Project 64 Legacy’ build (1.6 interface, modern core): fixes crashes/audio crackle and better instruction support, solving previous testing instability.
development_findings.quote: I have a super top secret version… audio crackling is gone, performance is a little bit better and it is more accurate.

development_findings.summary: He plans to experiment with the upcoming Raytracing64 graphics plugin once it is stable.
development_findings.quote: Yes, there is a plugin like that… when it comes out, it will change a lot of things.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is frustrated by repeated emulator recommendations and small Restream chat UI issues.
context_findings.quote: I'm a little bit on edge about people recommending me emulators… they are badgering you about that so much.

context_findings.summary: He is mid-cut at the gym: lost 17 lbs in six weeks (now 210 lbs), admits rushing weight loss caused minor injuries.
context_findings.quote: I'm bad at cuts 'cause I get impatient… I lose weight so fast that I am getting injured.

context_findings.summary: Personal design philosophy: dislikes wait-based bosses; wants ‘free-form’ encounters where the player can inflict damage any time.
context_findings.quote: Most of the bosses are like freeform bosses… you never have that situation where you just stand around awkwardly and wait.

context_findings.summary: Sees the project as targeting a more hardcore audience than Nintendo’s mass-appeal titles.
context_findings.quote: For a weird nerd that's been playing Nintendo games in his basement for 25 years, my game is definitely going to be way better.

biobak.summary: A forthcoming ‘Biobak rework’ will overhaul Course 12 visuals; Kaze expects it to make the section "instantly much better".

zeina.summary: Active in chat but no development tasks discussed; playful bowling challenge with Kaze shows personal rapport.
zeina.quote: I will absolutely destroy you in bowling, Zeina.

key_stories.title: Course 12 Overhaul
key_stories.summary: After deciding the original layout felt weak, Kaze cut an entire sub-area, relocated the train station, and conceived a Boshi showdown to give the Wild-West zone more character.
key_stories.challenge: The course "was not very good" and lacked a memorable set-piece.
key_stories.process: Removed a redundant area, repositioned key hub geometry, and brainstormed new narrative beat (Boshi duel).
key_stories.outcome: Course now feels cohesive and thematically strong; new cut-scene will reward players with a star.
key_stories.key_quote: I realized the course is not very good, and I think now it is good.

key_stories.title: Taming the Mine
key_stories.summary: Kaze designs the Goomba hideout cave, placing fireplaces, red coins, and planning minecart physics to enable high-momentum platforming.
key_stories.challenge: Needed engaging traversal loops and final red-coin placement without overwhelming players.
key_stories.process: Iterated on geometry, added wobbling bridges, tested jumps, positioned campfires as landmarks, and penciled in minecart paths.
key_stories.outcome: Level flow now allows multiple routes and a dramatic cart jump; only minecart code remains.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm really liking the free-flow platforming in this area… the minecarts are a necessity for this area to work.

key_stories.title: The Emulator Crisis
key_stories.summary: Frequent crashes on Project 64 1.6 slowed testing, so Kaze switched to a private ‘Legacy’ build despite chat pushing other emulators.
key_stories.challenge: Legacy Mario 64 engine needs stable N64 emulation; 1.6 was crashing and community suggestions irritated Kaze.
key_stories.process: Tested new in-development build with 1.6 UI but modern core; resisted chat pressure to change again.
key_stories.outcome: Crashes and audio crackle eliminated, development pace restored.
key_stories.key_quote: The version I'm using is literally released today – performance is better and it doesn't crash.

open_questions.context: Kaze outlined the concept but not the technical or artistic execution.
questions: How will the quick-draw mechanic be coded on N64 hardware?
Will Zeina animate unique Boshi poses or is it all handled through code-driven poses?
What inspired turning Boshi into a repentant bandit, and how does it fit the hack’s broader story?

open_questions.context: Minecarts are planned to carry momentum that players leverage for long jumps; the system is not yet coded.
questions: What technical hurdles exist in adding moving platforms with preserved momentum on the SM64 engine?
How will camera and collision be managed to keep rides smooth?
Any fallback plan if performance drops on real N64 hardware?

open_questions.context: Kaze noted KakiDev’s idea of converting runtime lists into arrays but hasn’t implemented it.
questions: Has the team profiled current bottlenecks to confirm this is worth pursuing?
Who would own this change and how would it blend with existing decomp code?
Could this optimisation affect modding tools or future patches?

open_questions.context: Kaze hinted that Biobak will overhaul Course 12’s art pass soon.
questions: What specific visual goals does Biobak have for the mine and train areas?
How does the art pipeline integrate with Kaze’s geometry-first workflow?
What lessons were learned from previous course reworks?

open_questions.context: Kaze is undecided about releasing a video on a Project 64 ACE vulnerability.
questions: What is the technical nature of the ACE exploit and why is disclosure risky?
How often does security influence hack development choices?
Could controlled disclosure or patch collaboration be a solution?
